body:
Comment 8: 
I think the answer is "don't do that."  With some extra code
we could make this code not return an error for "foo", but if
your example had been "foo1/foo2" then there would be no
way to make it work.  I don't think it's worth it.

I don't know how Lstat could be out of date unless you had
some other program creating and removing the directory
behind its back, as you do in your example.  It seems very
contrived.

Russ
